reviews.text: Really interesting museum for those who love trains and history.

Not only a witness to railway history, but also a testimony of Sino-Japanese War, the museum systematically guides you through the construction, finance, and evolution…etc of the railway system in the region. The ground floor is a huge exhibition hall of antique locomotives and train compartments of different models, some of which once in service over a hundred years ago. The French-made Michelin rubber-tyre passenger diesel locomotive was particularly impressive. (Jun 2014)
云南省铁路的历史呈现，近代云南在法国的推动下融入世界贸易、交通网络的见证。展现近代以来多国制造机车，如果去过建水，乘坐过建水的小火车，对昆明的这座博物馆会有更深的理解。
對整個雲南鐵路發展有詳細的介紹，來此加上搭小火車應最少安排半天的時間
讲述了二十世纪初滇越铁路的历史，和云南铁路百年来的发展。有不同时期的多种火车头实物展出。
那天路过貌似在扩建，现在好像是对学生免费开放！

One Of the Most Beautiful Chinese Lakes In The Heart Of Kunming City. Seagulls Come Rushing To This Lake In Winter.One Of the Must Visit Lake If You Are Staying Or Visiting Kunming. It is pure Natural Beauty ❤️
Great view of the lake. Nice place to have a long walk by the lake.
Just loved it.. I'll highly recommend to go to this wonderful place, it has it's own natural beauty, we love sea foods...
The water is very poluted but it's a big lake
Nice outdoor location with fun activities.

Okay, the maps and signs here really sucked. What made this even loosely worth four stars were the bell tower and the main palace complex. There were also some interesting birds. Everything inside is quite touristy, so if you want snacks or water, pack it in.
.I k
Tempat yang bagus, lumayan melelahkan sekitar 900 lebih anak tangga, tapi terbayarkan setelah sampai tempatnya

慢慢走
邊走邊拍照
很不錯的地方
旅遊書上沒寫  昆明在地人推薦的景點   想了解吳三桂一定要來  大概需要花三到四個小時

Visit here let us know how big this world... Not just daily activities ... Have a break ...take pictures, enjoy the atmosphere. Listen to the nature... And see what we should do more to protect the nature for our next generation.

Famed for its cave systems. 
Location for a few movie sets. 
Can explore the cave systems but prepare to walk up and down hundreds of steps.

A rockscave place that located at Jiuxiang, which had been in a movie call The Legend (神话) act by Jackie Chan. There was a huge waterfall that made me impress and the rocks cave have lots of different shape and size that through by water, oxygen and time.

A wonderful place to explore and I like the trekking part and cable car part. Can see it t
JIUXIANG WHOLE SCENERY!

It was an amazing experience visiting this treasure from mother nature. First of all, we began with a short boat ride at the bottom of the canyon. Then we walked through naturally carved caves and admired at the stalactites. It's enormous inside and you find river through the caves and water dribbling through the rocks and even giant waterfalls inside. The final cable ride that took us a out of the caves was an unforgettable experience as the view was stunning. Beware, it's gonna be long day with a lot of stairs. The walk took us 2-3 hours in total.

Very large limestone caves with lots of features to explore. Most signs are in both Chinese and English. We found the entrance procedures confusing as we did not know Chinese and we didn't have a guide. However, once that was overcome with a helpful staff member,  we had a lovely and exhausting day together.
Used to be one of the favourite Chinese restaurants for expats and students. Remember I came here about 12 years ago for the first time. Very decent Chinese food and cheap price.

We stumbled across this cramped restaurant in a street next to the Green Lake.  There was a great selection of dishes on the menu and we chose 4 of them.  We really liked our cumin beef and mushrooms with broccoli.  The fried goats cheese was ok but we found the hot and sour mixed vegetable soup far too salty and ended up leaving most of it.  Seating on the second floor is very cramped - you need to duck so that you don't bump your head on the low ceiling.

If you are new to china and nervous about going to local restaurants, but want to get your hands on some of the local cuisine, this is a great place to go. Its easy to find, located in the heart of the expat district of Kunming, and is often very full. Very little seating is found downstairs, so often you are upstairs in the loft which has an extremely low ceiling. However, once you navigate to your table, hunched over the whole way, you'll be presented with an English menu that has a good variety of Chinese dishes, many of which are unique to Yunnan. The cumin and mint beef, Yunnan mashed potatoes, fried red beans, and the fried Yunnan cheese slices are all excellent.
Fantastic authentic Yunnan food. Also great prices. Good place for small group meals
Some of the best food in Kunming!

One of the oldest western cafes / restaurants in town. The owner is very friendly and always smiling. I often come here to buy bread, as I think they have one of the best wholegrain breads in Kunming. Food is so so and menu also really outdated with no fresh juices.

I'm not usually one to eat western food while overseas, but I was craving a western style dessert, and the tart in the window caught my eye. Long story short, it's one of the best tarts I've ever had. Seems like they have a bar and even board games too. Awesome place.
Great Bread. Had breakfast here a few times and loved every time. Very good coffee.
delicious bakery/good cafe/bar...? A very old french venue.
Great REAL bread though a little pricey

Good cakes and coffee and decent selection of Western foods including sandwiches, salads and pasta. Bit pricey (neatly 30 yuan for a slice of cake) but nice interior and seating. English menus, not much spoken
We dropped in for coffee at this cosy European themed café.  The coffee was excellent but we thought that it was a little expensive.
A classic in Kunming. They've been around for as long as I can remember and have a good variety of Western food options, starting with breakfast and ending with evening snacks.
Good Place to be! Taste of the Curry Dishes is great!!!!
Typical Kunming fusion cafe. Second floor by the window, can smoke and enjoy people-watching
Great food, great atmosphere, great band.

地元チベット料理
ヤクのバター、ヤクの舌など
要说口味其实也就这样，辣的比较多，上次带老人来吃，他们都不爱吃辣的，人的确是很多，提前10天定的位子。价格很实惠，红烧肉味道很赞
歌舞很好，人也热情
The administrator lady is very rude. She goes to kitchen without uniform. We tried to ask her why but the answer was: It is not your bussiness.The vodka quality is very bad (we had Beluga on friday).
Been there many times during my 4-month stay in Almaty.  Nice place but bit expensive in terms of Almaty.
Legendary place and good food
Great music and dancing

Great look and atmosphere
Discovered to late but definitely coming back
